config.question: What led to the establishment of the National Collegiate Athletic Association?

choices.content: desire to win more Olympic medals than other countries
efforts to promote black athletes and black colleges
increased public desire to participate in individual sports

answer_3.response: Football drew fans, although critics attacked its violence and the use of “tramp athletes,” nonstudents whom colleges paid to play. In 1905, the worst year, 18 players were killed and 150 seriously injured. Alarmed, President Theodore Roosevelt called a White House conference to clean up college sports. The conference founded the Intercollegiate Athletic Association, which in 1910 became the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA).
